The unique Stoudion is Byzantium's replacement for the Garden under Theodora. Producing a small amount of Faith over the Garden, the Stoudion benefits your Missionaries by granting then additional Movement and removing their Sight Penalty. Stoudions also do not require access to Fresh Water. Ensure that you build Stoudions at your centres for religious propagation.

The unique Stoudion is Byzantium's replacement for the Monastery under Theodora. Having a Great Work of Art slot over the Monastery, the Stoudion benefits your Missionaries by granting then additional Movement and removing their Sight Penalty. Ensure that you build Stoudions at your centres for religious propagation.

The Monastery of Stoudios, more fully Monastery of Saint John the Forerunner "at Stoudios", often shortened to Stoudios, Studion, or Stoudion, was historically the most important monastery of Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul), the capital of the Byzantine Empire. The residents of the monastery were referred to as Stoudites (or Studites). Although the monastery has been derelict for half a millennium, the laws and customs of the Stoudion were taken as models by the monks of Mount Athos and of many other monasteries of the Orthodox world; even today they have influence.
